By placing the red ball in this position, when the simulation starts, both the teal and red balls will fall due to gravity. The red ball, being placed slightly to the left of the teal ball's initial vertical path, will collide with it. This collision imparts a crucial horizontal force, pushing the teal ball towards the right. Without this push, the teal ball would simply fall straight down along the black bar and miss the purple target.
